00048 
00049 // The global count of items allocated by this program.
00050 // We increment this counter for each file and dir.
00051 int TmpFileFactory::m_fileCount=0;
00052 
00053 int TmpFileFactory::incFileCounter() {
00054   m_fileCount++;
00055   return m_fileCount;
00056 }
00057 
00059 
00061 static TmpFileFactory* global_tmpfilefactory;
00062 
00063 TmpFileFactory* GlobalTmpFileFactory() {
00064   if (global_tmpfilefactory==NULL) {
00065     global_tmpfilefactory=new TmpFileFactory();
00066   }
00067   if (global_tmpfilefactory==NULL) {
00068     Err::errAbort("GlobalTmpFileFactory: Unable to allocate.");
00069   }
00070   return global_tmpfilefactory;
00071 }
00072 
00073 void GlobalTmpFileFactoryFree() {
00074   if (global_tmpfilefactory!=NULL) {
00075     global_tmpfilefactory->cleanUp();
00076     delete global_tmpfilefactory;
00077   }
00078 }

00081 
00082 TmpFileFactory::TmpFileFactory()
00083 {
00084   m_maxTrialCnt=10;
00085   //
00086   m_prefix="tmpfile-";
00087   m_suffix=".tmp";
00088   m_tmpdir=".";
00089   //
00090   m_opt_debug=0;
00091   m_opt_verbose=0;
00092 
00093   // look at the env var to see if debugging should be turned on.
00094 #ifdef unix
00095   char* val=getenv("APT_TMPFILE_DEBUG");
00096   if (val!=NULL) {
00097     std::string val_string=val;
00098     if (val_string=="1") {
00099       m_opt_debug=1;
00100     }
00101   }
00102 #endif
00103 
00104 };
00105 
00106 TmpFileFactory::~TmpFileFactory()
00107 {
00108   // get rid of the tmp files when we die
00109   cleanUp();
00110 };

00138 void TmpFileFactory::rememberToRemove(const std::string& filename)
00139 {
00140   m_tmpfilenames.push_back(filename);
00141 }
00142 
00143 void TmpFileFactory::rememberToRemoveDir(const std::string& dirname)
00144 {
00145   m_tmpdirnames.push_back(dirname);
00146 }
00147 
00149 
00150 void
00151 TmpFileFactory::cleanUp()
00152 {
00153   std::string path;
00154   bool rv;
00155 
00156   for (int i=0;i<m_tmpfilenames.size();i++) {
00157     path=m_tmpfilenames[i];
00158     if (m_opt_verbose>0) {
00160       std::cout << "TmpFileFactory::cleanUp(): rm '"+path+"'"<<std::endl;
00161     }
00162     if (m_opt_debug<1) {
00163       rv=Util::fileRemove(path,false); // dont throw an error
00164     }
00165   }
00166   // remove the dirs in reverse order as the low number dirs might contain high numbered dirs.
00167 
00168   for (int i=(int)m_tmpdirnames.size()-1;0<=i;i--) {
00169     path=m_tmpdirnames[i];
00170     if (m_opt_verbose>0) {
00172       std::cout << "TmpFileFactory::cleanUp(): rmdir '"+path+"'"<<std::endl;
00173     } 
00174     if (m_opt_debug<1) {
00175       rv=Util::dirRemove(m_tmpdirnames[i],false);
00176     }
00177   }
00178 }
00179 
00181 
00182 std::string
00183 TmpFileFactory::genUniqueString()
00184 {
00185   char buf[50];
00186   
00187   // the combination of pid and file counter should make it unique.
00188   // add some "random" digits to help make it so.
00189   snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"%d-%06d-%06d%06d",
00190            getpid(),
00191            incFileCounter(),
00192            (rand()%1000000),(rand()%1000000));
00193 
00194   return std::string(buf);
00195 }
00196 
00197 std::string
00198 TmpFileFactory::genFilename_basic(const std::string& prefix,const std::string& suffix)
00199 {
00200   int trialcnt=0;
00201   std::string tmpfilename;
00202 
00203   while (1) {
00204     tmpfilename=m_tmpdir+PATH_SEPARATOR+prefix+genUniqueString()+suffix;
00205     // Does this file exist?
00206     if (!Util::fileReadable(tmpfilename)) {
00207       if (m_opt_verbose>=1) {
00208         std::cout<< "TmpFileFactory::genFilename()=='"+tmpfilename+"'\n";
00209       }
00210       return tmpfilename;
00211     }
00212     if (trialcnt++>m_maxTrialCnt) {
00213       Err::errAbort("unable to allocate a tmpfile! Last filename tried: '"+tmpfilename+"'");
00214     }
00215   }
00216 }
00217 
00218 std::string
00219 TmpFileFactory::genFilename(const std::string& prefix,const std::string& suffix)
00220 {
00221   std::string filename=genFilename_basic(m_prefix,m_suffix);
00222   // we will want to remove it later.
00223   rememberToRemove(filename);
00224   return filename;
00225 }
00226 
00227 std::string
00228 TmpFileFactory::genFilename()
00229 {
00230   // use the default prefix and suffix
00231   return genFilename(m_prefix,m_suffix);
00232 }
00233 
00234 std::vector<std::string>
00235 TmpFileFactory::genFilenames(int cnt)
00236 {
00237   std::vector<std::string> vec;
00238   for (int i=0;i<cnt;i++) {
00239     vec.push_back(genFilename());
00240   }
00241   return vec;
00242 }
00243 
00244 std::string
00245 TmpFileFactory::genDirname()
00246 {
00247   // no suffix
00248   std::string dirname=genFilename_basic(m_prefix,"");
00249   //
00250   Util::makeDir(dirname);
00251   //
00252   if (!Util::directoryWritable(dirname)) {
00253     Err::errAbort("TmpFileFactory::genDirname(): cant write to '"+dirname+"'");
00254   }
00255   rememberToRemoveDir(dirname);
00256 
00257   return dirname;
00258 }
00259 
00260 std::string
00261 TmpFileFactory::getSystemTmpDir()
00262 {
00263 #ifdef WIN32
00264   // what is the tmp file dir for windows?
00265   return ".";
00266 #else
00267   return "/var/tmp";
00268 #endif
00269 }
